PathOfBuilding.Notes:
^7Most important advice:
OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL ^xE05030OVERLEVEL^7 OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL OVERLEVEL
With that out of the way, some tips:
- Iron Ring + Red Gem = Ruby Ring, very useful early on! - Only enable RF after the first fire mastery and only if you feel comfortable when you enable it - Very easy to resist cap, use your suffixes for regen/chaos res/attributes - This build has very little single target, you rely on your penance mark minions in maps to explode on the boss(or minions that are around the boss), your clear is good though(nice for getting to level 90!) - Get some area of effect and ignite chance where you can, this will help your clear a lot. All your exarch implicit currency should go towards getting ignite prolif on gloves as this is amazing for clear - With a rise of the phoenix you could be slightly overcapped on fire res(as in: you have more than 90 max res, but it's capped to 90), feel free to drop a mastery or two for less max res.

SkillSet.title: Level 1 - 12: Make a Templar for missing gems!
